data.title: Nice wine and friendly  staff
data.text: We have visited for appetizers and wine tasting and taken friends for tasting.  Great friendly staff that helped us find concerts and other activities around the area.

data.title: Nice place. Nice people. Nice cheese plate. Awful wine.
data.text:
This wine is wacko! Some really odd twinges on the end. Highly acidic and heavy sulfur! My wife and I tasted 2 of the whites and 4 of the Reds. And they're reserve was 52.00 a bottle and it was something I wouldn't serve my enemies! Trust me please. I get wine is a matter of taste, but this was some really odd stuff. If you like wine unfiltered Wine, with a rough edge to it,  Then you'll love it! 

Just a main point though- The people are wonderful and the atmosphere was nice. We did have a good time tasting some really odd wine. AntoLin across the street was really awesome wine though! INCREDIBLE.

data.title: Nice Tasting Room
data.text: Boutique wines. They make pretty good wines, especially their rose and reds. I recommend their 2013 Horse heaven Hills Cab, Left Bank and Allobroges.

data.title: Folklife
data.text: Stumbled on this tasting room during folklife.  The live music was and atmosphere superb - the wine was pretty good, not great.

data.title: Too Late to Taste
data.text: We were referred to Gilbert Cellars by an investment adviser friend familiar with the winery. We arrived at 6:35 pm (open till 7) and were told we could not do a tasting, only glass pours, with no explanation. I dare say the 3 people in front of us spent more time there drinking glasses of wine than we would have sharing a few tastes. We typically taste and buy but not at Gilbert Cellars ever again.

owner_response.author: Jessica H, Manager at Gilbert Cellars, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We're sad to learn that you didn't have a great time in our tasting room! From your review, it seems as though you visited us on a weeknight. Currently, our policy is that last call for tastings is a half hour before close, which allows our customers to enjoy themselves freely, without feeling rushed. We apologize if that policy wasn't clearly relayed to you.
 
Feedback gives us the necessary tools to coach staff, amend policies, and improve for our community. We certainly appreciate it in all forms, especially when it is part of a conversation. If you’d like, reach out to our tasting room manager at 509-249-9049x3.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A surprising find
data.text: We stopped in Yakima for a short visit and found Gilbert Cellars for a quick wine tasting. The wine is amazing and the tasting was great. We highly recommend this place for wine tasting and a definite wine purchase. Stands up with the best of them!

data.title: Wine and music!, oh yes!
data.text: Great place to unwind, either in their up-stairs wine tasting room, or down-stairs while enjoying live music in a "music-cave" with your favorite Malbec.

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: Granted, we stopped in on a Wednesday afternoon, so they weren't busy at all, but Kelly still made our tasting experience memorable! She was very knowledgable on their various wines. Their cab and port were both quite delicious! We ended up buying a couple of bottles and came very close to joining their wine club. After our wonderful tasting, Kelly told us about some of the other local attractions she recommended. Great experience and we will be back!

data.title: Hacket Ranch and Gilbert Cellars = enchanting combination!
data.text: I have now been out to Hacket Ranch attending Gilbert Cellars events.  This is a must for those wine lovers who also love to take in the beautiful Yakima Valley.  Nestled in west valley area surrounded by orchards Hacket Ranch is relaxing and beautiful.  The events I have attended have been very well planned.  Gilbert Cellars continues to produce quality wine at a reasonable price point.  Staff are ALWAYS friendly, helpful and obviously enjoy what they do.  I look forward to the summer and attend their concert series, soaking up some sunshine and share a bottle of wine. If you have a chance to attend one of their events, do it!

data.title: Great Wine
data.text: On our visit we tasted several of the Gilbert Wines and wow - this is a sold line up! If you are in Yakima - it is worth the stop!

data.title: Excellent wine, limited food service
data.text: Truth is, we went here for the wine, which is fantastic - so much so, that we signed up for their wine club.  A few more nibbles on offer would have been nice, but those we did have, a cheese plate and the hot dates, were very good.

data.title: No longer a Wine Bar after 4:00; Tasting Room straight through...
data.text: Enjoyed a nice wine flight, with a plentiful Charcuterie plate, and a lovely conversation with the gal who served us. We chose this place based on reviews that spoke about the switch to a Wine Bar at 4:00 with live music and enough small plates offered to make a "dinner". But they don't do that anymore. They remain as a Tasting Room right up to closing, and have scaled back to just 4 little tasting plates. Shame...but still worth a visit.

data.title: Many times, always good
data.text: Our favorite tasting room in downtown Yakima.  Great people, great wine.  Good place to begin or end a night out.

data.title: Just wanted to taste Gilbert wines :(
data.text: Heard this cellar was highly recommended. Me an my girlfriend wanted to do a little wine tasting at the only wine cellar on Yakima Ave. After arriving just past 6 pm we entered the wine cellar and hear the host ask the.. & i assume manager what she should do with these 2 kids. We heard him reply.. " whatever u want" then we were informed wine tasting is un available.  But if we wanted to buy a bottle of wine than we would be welcomed to those selections.  We found this odd because 2 other couples seemed to be enjoying wine without buying a bottle. We than began to ask where we may find a wine tasting cellar and they tried directing us to "front street" for reviews unfamiliar with the area front street is where the crimes occur in yakima. .. why we would be directed to this area at such a late time is only our luck that we do know the area. Also want to add they are the only wine cellar DT yakima ave. Why they first deny first time guest and direct them into danger is beyond me. As a local business manager i can say i will never send my guests to this cellar knowing they may be treated the same way.

owner_response.author: Jessica H, Manager at Gilbert Cellars, responded to this review
owner_response.text: I'm sorry to hear you didn't have a great experience at Gilbert Cellars! We are unique in that we are a tasting room until 4pm, and then offer Wine Bar services after 4pm. In the evenings, we focus on wines by the glass and bottle as well as small plates. However, you still have the option to taste and staff should have shared that, so I hope you'll try us again! If you are still looking for other wineries in downtown Yakima, you might try Kana, Lookout Point or Antolin--all of whom offer wine tasting. As for Front Street, our business association has been very active over the last 5+ years and our experience is that it is one of the safest areas in Yakima. We love being part of the historic district--one of the best times to visit is when we have events like Brews & Blues or Roots and Vines. Lots of people around enjoying the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Small plates and great wine
data.text: We stopped here on a Friday night for an appetizer and glass of wine and ended up staying for a couple hours.  The small plate selections were delicious. We had bacon wrapped dates stuffed with cheese.  Wow.  Fresh and yummy! Then, ordered a tasty salmon pate. We were really impressed with the food and was too full to go to dinner! We also had a couple flights of wine.  You can choose 3 wines to taste at a very reasonable price.  The service was super friendly and knowledgeable. If we lived here, this would be our go-to date night place.

data.title: Very nice place
data.text: Went there for a friend's birthday surprise party... One of the finest places we've been in Yakima. Excellent wine selection (try their Malbec - you wont be dissapointed).

data.title: Where there too late?
data.text:
Came highly recommended, but didn't live up to it.
Wish we were given more than the wine menu, the folks that had food and cheese plates looked happy. We would have ordered something, but felt ignored. Wine was ok. Better luck next time!

owner_response.author: Jessica H, Manager at Gilbert Cellars, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Richard! I'm sorry to hear you weren't offered our food selections. We produce a rotating list of small plates and exclusively use our chalkboard menu to list them. It seems like staff didn't direct you to the list, and for that I'm sorry! I do hope you'll try us again--we're offering lots of great summer veggies and local Tieton Creamery cheeses this time of year. Cheers!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Cheers for Gilbert Cellars
data.text: Stopped by this quaint tasting room in downtown Yakima last week.  What a great surprise!  The wines were very good and the staff friendly.  I was particularly taken with some of the reds and a bottle of their 2012 mourvedre went home in the suitcase.  The Bordeaux style Left Bank was also incredibly drinkable and will fit most budgets.  The tasting fee was five dollars which was applied to the purchase.

data.title: in town tasting experience
data.text:
pleasant in-town tasting of some very intersting wines...the ambiance was of a nice quiet wine bar...relaxing and different from a vineyard experience. the evening availability was key for our selection here.
we sampled only red wines and purchased a lovely manchego and membrillo (?) plate to accompany the wine.
a minimal tasting fee was applied to the wine we purchased.
the staff was friendly and knowledgeable.

data.title: The best wine tasting place in Yakima!
data.text: Not only does Gilbert Cellars have excellent wine, the tasting room is relaxed, comfortable and fun! The person presenting the wines was most knowledgeable and helpful. There is no cost for tasting if a purchase is made. Excellent red and white wines!
